definition[0]: to hit your open hands together, to show that you have enjoyed a play, concert, speaker etc
example[1]: A crowd of 300 supporters warmly applauded her speech.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say clap rather than applaud:
definition[1]: to express strong approval of an idea, plan etc
example[3]: I applaud the decision to install more security cameras.
example[4]: She should be applauded for her honesty.
